result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommie Levante Dixon

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Notice of hearing and PD information returned as NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
(another notice of hearing mailed to defendant by clerk with PD's information sheet included)

ADDRESS INFO for Tommie Levante Dixon
Current: 1718 North 9th Street, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States  (Effective: 09-21-2022)
Prior: 1217 S 10th St A, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Zoom appearances.
Counsel waived.
GUILTY plea entered to the charge of disorderly conduct-dvo. Convicted.
The Court sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for three (3) days, time served.
Credit of 3 days given.
$543.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 11-20-22 or 11 days county jail for failure to pay.
DNA sample ordered.
After the court was finished imposing sentence, the defendant states that he didn't want to plead guilty, but wanted to plead not guilty.  So, based on this, the Court vacates the conviction and allows the defendant to withdraw his plea.
The defendant is told to contact the public defender's office for representation. 
Scheduling conference is set for 10-19-22 at 9:45 a.m.
Minutes.
Plea hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:14 am - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tommie Levante Dixon in court.  Counsel waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.  Court sets bail at $150.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no abusive or assaultive contact with K.S., DOB: 06-17-2001.  Bail furnished.

Re:  Disorderly conduct (DVO), on 06-06-22.   
Initial appearance is set for 08-04-22 at 10:30 a.m.
